title: Advanced UI Animations & Micro-interactions
description:
Implement sophisticated animations and micro-interactions for a professional, polished user experience.

ANIMATION CATEGORIES:
1. Navigation Transitions - Smooth tab changes, modal presentations
2. Data Updates - Hours counters, status changes, real-time updates
3. User Feedback - Button presses, form validation, completion states
4. Loading States - Network requests, data processing, background sync
5. Contextual Animations - Shift state changes, calendar interactions

MICRO-INTERACTIONS:
- Haptic feedback for important actions (shift start/end)
- Button press animations with scale and opacity
- Shift card expand/collapse with spring animations
- Pull-to-refresh with custom loading indicator
- Success/error states with meaningful visual feedback

ADVANCED ANIMATIONS:
- Shared element transitions between views
- Custom timing curves for natural motion
- Particle effects for milestone celebrations (pay period complete)
- Lottie animations for complex illustrations
- Hero animations for shift creation flow

ACCESSIBILITY CONSIDERATIONS:
- Respect Reduce Motion accessibility setting
- Alternative feedback for users who disable animations
- Focus management during animated transitions
- VoiceOver announcements for animated state changes
- High contrast mode compatibility

FILES TO CREATE:
- /ShiftPro/Animations/AnimationManager.swift - Central coordinator
- /ShiftPro/Animations/TransitionAnimations.swift - View transitions
- /ShiftPro/Animations/MicroInteractions.swift - Small interactions
- /ShiftPro/Animations/HapticManager.swift - Haptic feedback
- /ShiftPro/Animations/LoadingStates.swift - Loading animations
- /ShiftPro/Animations/CustomAnimations.swift - Complex animations
- /ShiftPro/Components/AnimatedComponents.swift - Reusable animated views

PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION:
- 60 FPS target for all animations
- Efficient Core Animation usage
- Memory management for Lottie files
- Battery impact monitoring
- Animation complexity scaling based on device capability

ANIMATION LIBRARY:
- Reusable animation modifiers for SwiftUI
- Configurable animation parameters
- Animation presets for consistency
- Debug mode for timing visualization
- A/B testing capability for animation variants

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- All animations run smoothly at 60 FPS
- Reduced Motion settings respected appropriately
- No animation-related crashes or memory leaks
- Haptic feedback enhances user experience
- Loading states provide clear feedback
- Animations feel purposeful, not decorative

ESTIMATED EFFORT: 12-16 hours
BLOCKERS: Requires base UI components

REASONING: Professional animations are crucial for police department adoption. Smooth, purposeful animations convey quality and reliability. Micro-interactions improve user satisfaction and reduce perceived loading times.

title: Security & Privacy Implementation
description:
Implement comprehensive security measures and privacy protection suitable for law enforcement use.

SECURITY REQUIREMENTS:
- Data encryption at rest and in transit
- Biometric authentication (Touch ID/Face ID)
- App lock with timeout configurable
- Secure data export with optional encryption
- Audit trail for sensitive operations

PRIVACY PROTECTION:
- Minimal data collection philosophy
- User control over all data sharing
- Clear privacy policy with law enforcement considerations
- GDPR and CCPA compliance
- Local-first data processing

ENCRYPTION IMPLEMENTATION:
- AES-256 encryption for sensitive data exports
- Keychain integration for secure credential storage
- SwiftData store file protection (.complete)
- Network requests over HTTPS with certificate pinning
- Secure CloudKit container configuration

AUTHENTICATION SYSTEM:
- Biometric authentication on app launch (optional)
- Configurable timeout (immediate to 1 hour)
- PIN/password fallback for biometric failures
- Emergency bypass for critical situations
- Authentication context for sensitive operations

FILES TO CREATE:
- /ShiftPro/Security/AuthenticationManager.swift - Auth coordination
- /ShiftPro/Security/EncryptionManager.swift - Data encryption
- /ShiftPro/Security/SecureStorage.swift - Keychain wrapper
- /ShiftPro/Security/PrivacyManager.swift - Privacy controls
- /ShiftPro/Views/Settings/SecuritySettingsView.swift - Security config
- /ShiftPro/Views/Settings/PrivacySettingsView.swift - Privacy controls

LAW ENFORCEMENT CONSIDERATIONS:
- Evidence chain requirements (audit trail)
- Court admissibility considerations
- Department policy compliance
- Data retention policies
- Secure data sharing with supervisors

PRIVACY MANIFEST:
- Comprehensive PrivacyInfo.xcprivacy file
- Clear declarations for all data usage
- Required reason API documentation
- Third-party SDK privacy impact
- User consent management

SECURITY AUDIT TRAIL:
- Log authentication attempts
- Track sensitive data access
- Export/import operation logging
- User consent change tracking
- Data deletion confirmation

THREAT MODEL:
- Device theft/loss protection
- Unauthorized app access prevention
- Data exfiltration protection
- Man-in-the-middle attack prevention
- Physical device inspection scenarios

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- All sensitive data encrypted properly
- Biometric authentication works reliably
- Privacy controls are comprehensive and clear
- Audit trail captures all required events
- Security measures don't impact user experience
- Compliance with law enforcement security standards

ESTIMATED EFFORT: 10-14 hours
BLOCKERS: Requires core data models and storage implementation

REASONING: Security and privacy are non-negotiable for law enforcement users. Police departments have strict data handling requirements. Comprehensive security builds trust and enables department-wide adoption. Privacy protection essential for individual officer acceptance.

title: Advanced Analytics & Insights Engine
description:
Implement sophisticated analytics system providing insights into work patterns, trends, and optimization opportunities.

ANALYTICS CATEGORIES:
1. Work Pattern Analysis - Shift timing, frequency, duration trends
2. Hours Optimization - Overtime patterns, efficiency insights
3. Health & Wellness - Work-life balance indicators
4. Performance Metrics - Shift completion rates, punctuality
5. Financial Insights - Earnings trends, pay optimization

TREND ANALYSIS:
- Weekly/monthly/yearly hour comparisons
- Overtime pattern identification
- Shift preference analysis (morning vs. evening)
- Pay period efficiency tracking
- Seasonal work pattern detection

PREDICTIVE FEATURES:
- Optimal shift scheduling suggestions
- Overtime early warning system
- Pay period projection based on current pace
- Pattern recommendations for work-life balance
- Burnout risk indicators

VISUALIZATION COMPONENTS:
- Interactive charts with drill-down capability
- Heat maps for shift timing patterns
- Trend lines with statistical significance
- Comparative analysis (vs. previous periods)
- Goal tracking with progress indicators

FILES TO CREATE:
- /ShiftPro/Analytics/AnalyticsEngine.swift - Core analytics processing
- /ShiftPro/Analytics/TrendAnalyzer.swift - Pattern detection
- /ShiftPro/Analytics/PredictiveModels.swift - Forecasting algorithms
- /ShiftPro/Analytics/InsightsGenerator.swift - Actionable insights
- /ShiftPro/Views/Analytics/AnalyticsDashboard.swift - Main analytics UI
- /ShiftPro/Views/Analytics/TrendChartsView.swift - Visualization
- /ShiftPro/Views/Analytics/InsightsView.swift - Recommendations

INSIGHT GENERATION:
- Automatic insight discovery from data patterns
- Personalized recommendations based on user behavior
- Comparative benchmarking (anonymized aggregate data)
- Goal achievement analysis
- Work-life balance scoring

PRIVACY & SECURITY:
- All analytics processed locally (no cloud analytics)
- User control over data sharing preferences
- Anonymization for any comparative features
- Data retention policies and cleanup
- Export capability for personal records

MACHINE LEARNING INTEGRATION:
- Pattern recognition using Core ML
- Personalized prediction models
- Anomaly detection for unusual patterns
- Recommendation engine for optimal scheduling
- Continuous learning from user behavior

PERFORMANCE CONSIDERATIONS:
- Background processing for heavy calculations
- Efficient data aggregation algorithms
- Caching for frequently accessed insights
- Progressive loading for large datasets
- Memory management for complex visualizations

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- Analytics provide actionable insights
- Trend detection accurately identifies patterns
- Predictions have reasonable accuracy (>80%)
- Visualizations are clear and informative
- Privacy controls function correctly
- Performance: <5s for complex analytics queries

ESTIMATED EFFORT: 14-18 hours
BLOCKERS: Requires substantial historical data for meaningful analytics

REASONING: Advanced analytics differentiate the app from simple time trackers. Police officers can benefit from insights about their work patterns to optimize earnings and work-life balance. Predictive features help with proactive planning and decision making.

title: ShiftPro iOS App - Epic
description:
Complete iOS shift planning app for police and other shift workers. Modern SwiftUI/SwiftData architecture with calendar sync, rate multipliers, and premium features.

BUSINESS GOALS:
- Target police officers primarily, extensible to other shift workers
- Speed and ease of use as primary UX goals
- Visually pleasing, professional interface
- Comprehensive shift management with overtime tracking
- Calendar integration for seamless workflow
- Premium monetization model

TECHNICAL ARCHITECTURE:
- MVVM + Clean Architecture pattern
- SwiftUI (iOS 17+) with SwiftData persistence
- CloudKit sync for multi-device support
- EventKit calendar integration
- StoreKit 2 for premium features
- Offline-first design with background sync

PHASES:
1. Foundation (Weeks 1-4): Core data models, basic CRUD, simple UI
2. Essential Features (Weeks 5-8): Shift patterns, calendar sync, hours calculation
3. UX Polish (Weeks 9-12): Advanced UI, notifications, performance optimization
4. Enhancement (Weeks 13-16): Apple Watch, Siri shortcuts, analytics

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- App Store ready with 4.5+ star potential
- <2s launch time, <100ms UI responsiveness
- Comprehensive test coverage (80%+ business logic)
- Production-ready security and privacy compliance

title: Project Setup & Architecture
description:
Initialize Xcode project with proper architecture, dependencies, and development tooling.

TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:
- iOS 17.0+ deployment target
- SwiftUI + SwiftData + CloudKit stack
- MVVM + Clean Architecture implementation
- Swift Package Manager dependencies

ARCHITECTURE DECISIONS:
- MVVM pattern for clear separation of concerns
- Repository pattern for data access abstraction
- Dependency injection for testability
- Observation framework for reactive UI updates

SETUP TASKS:
1. Create new Xcode project 'ShiftPro'
2. Configure project settings (deployment target, bundle ID)
3. Add Swift Package dependencies:
   - KeychainAccess for secure storage
   - Lottie for animations (future)
   - Charts for visualizations (future)
4. Implement folder structure:
   - /Models (SwiftData models)
   - /Views (SwiftUI views)
   - /ViewModels (Presentation logic)
   - /Services (Business logic)
   - /Repositories (Data access)
   - /Utils (Helper functions)
5. Configure SwiftLint for code quality
6. Set up unit testing target with proper structure

FILES TO CREATE:
- ShiftPro.xcodeproj - Main project
- Package.swift - Dependencies (if using SPM in workspace)
- .swiftlint.yml - Code quality rules
- /ShiftPro/ShiftProApp.swift - App entry point
- /ShiftPro/ContentView.swift - Initial root view
- /ShiftProTests/ShiftProTests.swift - Test setup

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- Xcode project builds successfully
- All dependencies resolve
- SwiftLint runs without errors
- Basic app launches and shows placeholder UI
- Unit test target configured and running
- Architecture folders created and documented

ESTIMATED EFFORT: 4-6 hours
DEPENDENCIES: None (first task)

REASONING: Proper project setup is critical foundation. Architecture decisions made here affect entire project. Taking time for good setup saves debugging later.

FILES (additional scope):
- /CLAUDE.md

title: Unit Testing Foundation
description:
Establish comprehensive unit testing framework with high coverage for core business logic and data operations.

TESTING STRATEGY:
- 80%+ code coverage for business logic layer
- Mock repositories for isolated testing
- Test data builders for consistent setup
- Performance testing for critical operations
- Edge case coverage for date/time handling

TEST CATEGORIES:
1. Model Tests - SwiftData model validation and relationships
2. Repository Tests - Data access with mock ModelContext
3. Business Logic Tests - ShiftManager calculations and operations
4. Utility Tests - Date extensions, formatters, calculators
5. Integration Tests - End-to-end workflows

MOCK INFRASTRUCTURE:
- MockShiftRepository implementing AbstractRepository
- MockModelContext for SwiftData testing
- Test data builders for models
- Date mocking for time-sensitive tests
- CloudKit sync mocking

CRITICAL TEST SCENARIOS:
- Hours calculation accuracy (regular, overtime, breaks)
- Pay period aggregation with different period types
- Shift overlap detection and validation
- Date/time handling across time zones and DST
- Rate multiplier application and edge cases

TESTING UTILITIES:
- XCTestCase extensions for common setup
- Custom assertions for model validation
- Date testing helpers (fixed dates, time zones)
- Performance measurement for calculations
- Snapshot testing for stable UI components

FILES TO CREATE:
- /ShiftProTests/TestUtilities/TestDataBuilder.swift - Model factories
- /ShiftProTests/TestUtilities/MockRepositories.swift - Repository mocks
- /ShiftProTests/TestUtilities/DateTestHelpers.swift - Date utilities
- /ShiftProTests/Models/UserProfileTests.swift - Model tests
- /ShiftProTests/Models/ShiftTests.swift - Shift model tests
- /ShiftProTests/Services/ShiftManagerTests.swift - Business logic
- /ShiftProTests/Services/HoursCalculatorTests.swift - Calculation tests
- /ShiftProTests/Repositories/ShiftRepositoryTests.swift - Data access

EDGE CASES TO TEST:
- Overnight shifts crossing midnight
- Daylight saving time transitions
- Leap year calculations
- Very long shifts (24+ hours)
- Negative time adjustments
- Rate multiplier bounds (0.1 to 5.0)

PERFORMANCE TESTS:
- Shift creation/update operations (<100ms)
- Large shift list queries (<500ms)
- Pay period calculations (<1000ms)
- Memory usage for large datasets

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- 80%+ code coverage achieved
- All business logic edge cases covered
- Performance tests pass consistently
- Mocks enable isolated unit testing
- Test suite runs in <30 seconds
- Continuous Integration ready

ESTIMATED EFFORT: 8-10 hours

title: Performance Optimization & Scalability
description:
Optimize application performance for large datasets and ensure scalability for long-term usage.

PERFORMANCE TARGETS:
- App launch time: <1.5 seconds cold start
- UI responsiveness: <100ms for all interactions
- Memory usage: <50MB baseline, <100MB under load
- Battery impact: Minimal background usage
- Large dataset handling: 5+ years of shift data

OPTIMIZATION AREAS:
1. Data Loading - Lazy loading, pagination, intelligent caching
2. UI Rendering - View recycling, efficient SwiftUI patterns
3. Database Operations - Query optimization, batch operations
4. Network Sync - Efficient CloudKit usage, background sync
5. Memory Management - Proper cleanup, image caching

DATABASE OPTIMIZATION:
- SwiftData query optimization with proper predicates
- Batch operations for large data imports
- Background context usage for heavy operations
- Data model indexing for common queries
- Pagination for large shift lists

UI PERFORMANCE:
- List virtualization for large datasets
- Image loading and caching strategy
- Efficient SwiftUI view updates
- Background processing for calculations
- Memory management for navigation stacks

CACHING STRATEGY:
- Intelligent caching of calculated data (hours, pay periods)
- Image cache for user avatars and icons
- Calendar event cache to reduce EventKit calls
- Pattern cache for shift generation
- Network response caching

PROFILING & MONITORING:
- Instruments profiling for performance bottlenecks
- Memory leak detection and prevention
- Battery usage monitoring
- Network usage optimization
- Crash reporting and analysis

FILES TO CREATE:
- /ShiftPro/Performance/CacheManager.swift - Intelligent caching
- /ShiftPro/Performance/DataPaginator.swift - Large dataset handling
- /ShiftPro/Performance/BackgroundProcessor.swift - Heavy operations
- /ShiftPro/Performance/PerformanceMonitor.swift - Runtime monitoring
- /ShiftPro/Performance/MemoryManager.swift - Memory optimization
- /ShiftPro/Utils/LazyLoading.swift - Efficient data loading

LARGE DATASET HANDLING:
- Pagination for shift lists (50-100 items per page)
- Efficient calendar views for multi-year data
- Background processing for pay period calculations
- Incremental loading for search results
- Smart data archiving for old shifts

BATTERY OPTIMIZATION:
- Background App Refresh limitations
- Efficient network request batching
- CloudKit sync optimization
- Location services management (future geofencing)
- Notification scheduling efficiency

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- Performance targets met under normal usage
- App handles 5 years of shift data smoothly
- Memory usage remains stable during long sessions
- Battery impact is negligible for typical usage
- Large imports complete without UI blocking
- Instruments profiling shows no major bottlenecks

ESTIMATED EFFORT: 14-18 hours
BLOCKERS: Requires substantial app functionality for testing

REASONING: Performance is critical for daily-use apps. Police officers can't afford slow tools during busy shifts. Optimization for large datasets ensures app remains useful as shift history grows over years of usage.

description:

description:
Implement comprehensive Siri Shortcuts for hands-free shift management and status queries.

- 'Hey Siri, when is my next shift?' - Schedule lookup

CONTEXT AWARENESS:

- User preference learning

SECURITY CONSIDERATIONS:
- Sensitive information handling in voice responses
- Authentication for critical actions
- Privacy protection in shared environments

- Data minimization in voice responses

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:

title: Advanced Shift Pattern Engine
description:
Implement sophisticated shift pattern generation supporting weekly schedules and complex rotation cycles.

PATTERN TYPES TO SUPPORT:
1. Weekly Patterns - Fixed days/times each week (M-F 9-5, every weekend)
2. Rotation Cycles - Complex cycles (4-on-4-off, 2-2-3-2-2-3, DuPont schedule)
3. Custom Patterns - User-defined irregular patterns
4. Holiday Overrides - Special scheduling for holidays/events

ROTATION CYCLE EXAMPLES:
- 4-on-4-off: 4 consecutive work days, 4 days off, repeat
- DuPont: 12-hour shifts, complex 4-week rotation
- 2-2-3-2-2-3: Continental shift pattern popular in manufacturing
- Pitman: 14-day cycle alternating day/night shifts

TECHNICAL IMPLEMENTATION:
- Pattern generator using date mathematics
- Template system for common police schedules
- Conflict detection and resolution
- Preview generation (1-6 month outlook)
- Pattern validation against business rules

PATTERN EDITOR FEATURES:
- Visual calendar builder for weekly patterns
- Cycle definition wizard for rotations
- Pattern preview with generated shifts
- Template library with police-specific patterns
- Pattern sharing/export between users

GENERATION ALGORITHM:
- Start date + cycle definition = infinite shift sequence
- Efficient generation (only calculate needed date ranges)
- Handle edge cases: leap years, month boundaries, DST
- Pattern modification without losing historical shifts

FILES TO CREATE:
- /ShiftPro/Services/PatternEngine.swift - Core generation logic
- /ShiftPro/Services/PatternTemplates.swift - Pre-built patterns
- /ShiftPro/Models/PatternDefinition.swift - Pattern data structures
- /ShiftPro/Views/Patterns/PatternEditorView.swift - Creation interface
- /ShiftPro/Views/Patterns/PatternPreviewView.swift - Visual preview
- /ShiftPro/Views/Patterns/PatternLibraryView.swift - Template browser
- /ShiftPro/Utils/DateMath.swift - Date calculation utilities

PATTERN VALIDATION:
- Maximum shift duration (e.g., 24 hours)
- Minimum rest between shifts (e.g., 8 hours)
- Weekly/monthly hour limits
- Consecutive day limits
- Pattern consistency checks

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- All common police patterns can be created
- Pattern generation handles 5+ years accurately
- Visual preview shows correct shift placement
- Performance: <1s to generate 6 months of shifts
- Patterns export/import correctly
- Business rule validation prevents invalid patterns

ESTIMATED EFFORT: 14-18 hours
BLOCKERS: Requires Phase 1 foundation

REASONING: Pattern flexibility essential for different police departments. Some use simple weekly schedules, others complex rotations. Getting this right enables broad adoption across departments with different shift structures.

title: Notification System & Background Tasks
description:
Implement comprehensive notification system with background processing for shift reminders and status updates.

NOTIFICATION FEATURES:
- Shift start reminders (customizable timing: 15min, 1hr, 2hr before)
- Shift end notifications with hours summary
- Overtime warning notifications (approaching limits)
- Pattern-based recurring notifications
- Weekly summary notifications with hours breakdown

NOTIFICATION TYPES:
1. Local Notifications - Time-based shift reminders
2. Background Processing - Hours calculations and sync
3. Critical Alerts - Overtime limit exceeded (if enabled)
4. Rich Notifications - Actionable (Start Shift, Log Hours)
5. Provisional Notifications - Gradual permission escalation

BACKGROUND TASK IMPLEMENTATION:
- BGTaskScheduler for periodic data processing
- Silent push for CloudKit sync updates
- Background calendar sync when app not active
- Hours calculation updates for pay period changes
- Notification scheduling maintenance

SMART NOTIFICATION LOGIC:
- Context-aware timing (don't notify during sleep hours)
- Adaptive frequency based on user interaction
- Intelligent batching to avoid notification spam
- Location-aware reminders (geofenced shifts - future)
- Do Not Disturb respect and time-sensitive overrides

PERMISSION STRATEGY:
- Progressive permission requests (start basic, escalate gradually)
- Clear value proposition for each notification type
- Graceful degradation when permissions denied
- Re-engagement flows for users who disabled notifications
- Settings screen for granular notification control

FILES TO CREATE:
- /ShiftPro/Services/NotificationManager.swift - Main coordinator
- /ShiftPro/Services/BackgroundTaskManager.swift - Background processing
- /ShiftPro/Services/NotificationScheduler.swift - Scheduling logic
- /ShiftPro/Models/NotificationSettings.swift - User preferences
- /ShiftPro/Views/Settings/NotificationSettingsView.swift - Configuration UI
- /ShiftProNotificationExtension/ - Rich notification handling

BACKGROUND PROCESSING:
- Hours calculation updates when shifts modified
- Pay period boundary calculations
- Calendar sync maintenance
- Notification queue management
- CloudKit sync coordination

NOTIFICATION CONTENT:
- Rich notifications with shift details
- Action buttons (Start Shift, Mark Complete, Snooze)
- Custom sounds for different notification types
- Badge count management for pending shifts
- Notification history and interaction tracking

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- Notifications fire reliably at correct times
- Background processing completes within time limits
- User can customize all notification preferences
- No notification spam or inappropriate timing
- Rich notifications provide useful actions
- Battery impact is minimal (<5% daily usage)

ESTIMATED EFFORT: 10-14 hours
BLOCKERS: Requires basic shift management functionality

REASONING: Notifications are critical for shift workers who can't constantly check their phone. Reliable reminders prevent missed shifts, which can have serious consequences in police work. Background processing ensures data stays current even when app not in use.
notes: Added NotificationSettings model + settings UI, NotificationManager/Scheduler, BackgroundTaskManager registration, and notification extension placeholder. Wired settings entry point.

Goal

title: Core Business Logic - ShiftManager
description:
Implement central ShiftManager service containing core business logic for shift operations, calculations, and state management.

CORE FUNCTIONALITY:
- Shift CRUD operations with validation
- Hours calculation engine (regular/premium/overtime)
- Current shift status tracking (in progress, upcoming)
- Shift pattern application and scheduling
- Pay period calculations and aggregation

SHIFT LIFECYCLE MANAGEMENT:
- Start shift: Record actual start time, validate not double-booked
- End shift: Calculate actual hours, apply break deductions  
- Edit shift: Maintain audit trail, recalculate dependent data
- Delete shift: Soft delete with cascade to calendar events

HOURS CALCULATION ENGINE:
- Base implementation: First 30 minutes unpaid break
- Rate multipliers: Regular (1.0), Overtime (1.3), Extra (1.5), Holiday (2.0)
- Pay period aggregation with different period types
- Support for custom PayRuleset JSON configurations

STATE MANAGEMENT:
- @Observable class for SwiftUI integration
- Published properties for current shift status
- Combine pipelines for complex data flows
- Background processing for heavy calculations

VALIDATION RULES:
- No overlapping shifts for same user
- Shift duration limits (e.g., max 24 hours)
- Break duration validation (min 0, max shift duration)
- Rate multiplier bounds checking

FILES TO CREATE:
- /ShiftPro/Services/ShiftManager.swift - Main service class
- /ShiftPro/Services/HoursCalculator.swift - Calculation engine
- /ShiftPro/Services/PayPeriodEngine.swift - Period aggregation
- /ShiftPro/Services/ShiftValidator.swift - Business rule validation
- /ShiftPro/Utils/DateExtensions.swift - Date/time utilities
- /ShiftProTests/ShiftManagerTests.swift - Comprehensive tests

EDGE CASES TO HANDLE:
- Shifts crossing midnight (use scheduled vs actual times)
- Daylight saving time transitions
- Leap years and month boundaries
- Very long shifts (16+ hours)
- Negative break times (data correction)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- All shift operations work end-to-end
- Hours calculations match expected results
- Current shift status updates in real-time
- Pay period calculations aggregate correctly
- Validation prevents invalid data states
- Performance: <100ms for typical operations

ESTIMATED EFFORT: 10-14 hours
BLOCKERS: Requires models and repositories

REASONING: ShiftManager is the heart of the application. All UI components will interact with this service. Getting business logic right here means the UI layer can focus purely on presentation. Comprehensive testing here prevents bugs in production.

description:
Build comprehensive hours tracking interface with pay period management and rate multiplier visualization.

DASHBOARD FEATURES:

- Historical pay period comparison and trends

- Export-ready summaries for payroll

- Trend analysis: comparing to previous periods
- Projected earnings based on current pace

- Automatic pay period calculation and boundaries
- Support for different period types (weekly, bi-weekly, monthly)
- Manual pay period adjustment for irregular schedules
- Historical period browsing and comparison
- Pay period status tracking (open, closed, submitted)

RATE MULTIPLIER SYSTEM:
- Default rates: 1.0 (Regular), 1.3 (OT Bracket), 1.5 (Extra), 2.0 (Holiday)
- Custom rate configuration per user/department
- Visual indicators for premium time
- Rate change history and audit trail
- Bulk rate updates for shifts

EARLY WARNING SYSTEM:
- Configurable overtime thresholds (e.g., warn at 35 hours)
- Daily/weekly projections based on scheduled shifts
- Smart notifications about approaching limits
- Shift suggestion engine to optimize hours
- Integration with shift scheduling to prevent overages

FILES TO CREATE:
- /ShiftPro/Views/Hours/HoursDashboard.swift - Main dashboard
- /ShiftPro/Views/Hours/PayPeriodDetailView.swift - Period breakdown
- /ShiftPro/Views/Hours/RateMultiplierView.swift - Rate management
- /ShiftPro/Components/Charts/HoursChart.swift - Visualization
- /ShiftPro/Components/Charts/RateBreakdownChart.swift - Rate charts
- /ShiftPro/Services/PayPeriodCalculator.swift - Period calculations
- /ShiftPro/Services/OvertimePredictor.swift - Warning system

DATA AGGREGATION:
- Efficient queries for large shift datasets
- Real-time updates as shifts are modified
- Caching for expensive calculations
- Background processing for historical analysis
- Export data preparation in multiple formats

EXPORT CAPABILITIES:
- PDF reports for payroll submission
- CSV data for spreadsheet analysis
- Email integration for sharing reports
- Print-friendly formatting
- Custom date range selection

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- All hours calculations are accurate to the minute
- Charts update in real-time as shifts change
- Pay period boundaries calculate correctly
- Early warning notifications fire appropriately
- Export formats are professional and complete
- Performance: <2s to load 12 months of data

ESTIMATED EFFORT: 12-16 hours
BLOCKERS: Requires basic business logic and UI foundation

REASONING: Hours tracking is the core value proposition. Police officers need accurate, real-time visibility into their earnings. Early warning system prevents costly overtime surprises for departments. Professional exports reduce administrative burden.
notes: Implemented HoursDashboard with pay period summary, charts, rate breakdown, overtime forecast, detail view, and rate multipliers. Added PayPeriodCalculator + OvertimePredictor plus UI compatibility aliases.

title: ModelContainer & Repository Setup
description:
Configure SwiftData ModelContainer with CloudKit sync and implement repository pattern for data access.

TECHNICAL OBJECTIVES:
- Set up encrypted SwiftData store with CloudKit sync
- Implement repository pattern for clean data access
- Configure CloudKit schema and permissions
- Add data access abstraction layer

MODELCONTAINER CONFIGURATION:
- File protection: .complete for at-rest encryption
- CloudKit database: .automatic for user's private database
- Migration support for schema changes
- Background context for heavy operations

REPOSITORY PATTERN IMPLEMENTATION:
- AbstractRepository protocol for testability
- ShiftRepository for shift CRUD operations
- UserProfileRepository for settings management
- Dependency injection for repositories into ViewModels

CLOUDKIT SETUP:
- Configure CloudKit schema in Xcode
- Set up CKContainer permissions
- Test sync across multiple devices/simulators
- Handle account status changes gracefully

FILES TO CREATE:
- /ShiftPro/Data/ModelContainer.swift - Container setup
- /ShiftPro/Repositories/AbstractRepository.swift - Base protocol
- /ShiftPro/Repositories/ShiftRepository.swift - Shift data access
- /ShiftPro/Repositories/UserProfileRepository.swift - User data
- /ShiftPro/Services/CloudKitManager.swift - Sync monitoring
- /ShiftPro/Utils/DataError.swift - Error handling

CLOUDKIT CONSIDERATIONS:
- User may not have iCloud account - graceful degradation
- Sync conflicts: last-writer-wins with updatedAt timestamps
- Large shift histories: implement pagination
- Account changes: preserve local data, pause sync

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- ModelContainer initializes successfully with CloudKit
- Data persists locally even without iCloud
- Sync works between devices when iCloud available
- Repository pattern abstracts SwiftData implementation
- Error handling covers common CloudKit scenarios
- Unit tests mock repositories effectively

ESTIMATED EFFORT: 6-8 hours
BLOCKERS: Requires core models to be implemented

REASONING: Repository pattern essential for testability and future platform expansion. CloudKit setup early prevents architectural debt. Encryption and sync are table stakes for professional app targeting police officers.

title: StoreKit 2 Premium Features & Monetization
description:
Implement subscription-based premium features using StoreKit 2 for sustainable monetization.

MONETIZATION STRATEGY:
- Freemium model with core features free
- Premium subscription for advanced features
- Department/enterprise pricing tiers
- Family sharing support for household officers
- Restore purchases across devices

FEATURE TIERS:
Free Tier:
- Local shift logging and basic calendar view
- 30-day history retention
- 1 active shift pattern
- Basic hours calculation
- Limited export options

Premium Tier (.99/month):
- Unlimited history and data retention
- Multiple shift patterns and complex rotations
- Two-way calendar sync with conflict resolution
- Advanced hours dashboard with analytics
- Full export capabilities (CSV, PDF, Excel)
- Priority customer support

Enterprise Tier (9.99/month):
- Department-wide features and sharing
- Advanced reporting and analytics
- Bulk operations and admin controls
- API access for integration
- Custom branding options

STOREKIT 2 IMPLEMENTATION:
- Product definitions in App Store Connect
- Subscription management with auto-renewal
- Family sharing configuration
- Promotional offers and trials
- Purchase validation and receipt checking

FILES TO CREATE:
- /ShiftPro/Services/EntitlementManager.swift - Feature access control
- /ShiftPro/Services/SubscriptionManager.swift - StoreKit 2 wrapper
- /ShiftPro/Views/Paywall/PaywallView.swift - Subscription interface
- /ShiftPro/Views/Settings/SubscriptionSettingsView.swift - Management UI
- /ShiftPro/Utils/ReceiptValidator.swift - Purchase verification

ENTITLEMENT SYSTEM:
- Feature flag system based on subscription status
- Graceful degradation when subscription expires
- Real-time entitlement updates
- Offline capability for core features
- Migration assistance for premium users

PAYWALL STRATEGY:
- Feature-gated approach (show value before asking)
- Multiple paywall entry points
- Clear value proposition for each tier
- Trial period promotion (7-day free)
- Testimonials from police departments

RECEIPT VALIDATION:
- Local receipt validation for privacy
- Server-side validation for enterprise features
- Fraud prevention measures
- Subscription status monitoring
- Auto-renewal failure handling

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- Subscription flow works end-to-end
- Feature access correctly gated by subscription status
- Family sharing functions properly
- Purchase restoration works across devices
- Paywall converts effectively (target: 5%+ conversion)
- No revenue leaks or entitlement bypasses

ESTIMATED EFFORT: 12-16 hours
BLOCKERS: Requires core features for freemium gating

REASONING: Sustainable monetization essential for long-term development and support. Police officers represent a professional market willing to pay for quality tools. Freemium model allows trial before purchase, reducing barrier to adoption while capturing revenue from engaged users.

IMPORT CAPABILITIES:

SECURITY & PRIVACY:

INTEGRATION FEATURES:

title: SwiftData Core Models Implementation
description:
Implement all SwiftData models with relationships, validation, and CloudKit sync support.

CRITICAL MODELS TO IMPLEMENT:
1. UserProfile - User settings, pay rules, department info
2. ShiftPattern - Reusable shift templates (weekly/cycling)
3. RotationDay - For cycling patterns (e.g., 4-on-4-off)
4. Shift - Individual shift instances with actual times
5. PayPeriod - Hour aggregation and pay calculation
6. PayRuleset - Pluggable pay rules (JSON-based)
7. CalendarEvent - Calendar sync tracking

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS:
- Use @Model macro for SwiftData persistence
- @Relationship for proper foreign keys
- @Attribute(.unique) for primary keys
- Raw value enums for CloudKit compatibility
- Minute-based storage for precision (not TimeInterval)
- Soft deletes with deletedAt timestamps
- Computed properties in extensions for presentation layer

DATA DESIGN DECISIONS:
- Store times as minutes since midnight for DST safety
- Use Int64 for currency (cents) to avoid floating point errors  
- JSON-based PayRuleset for flexibility across departments
- Separate scheduled vs actual times for real-world tracking
- Rate multipliers (1.0, 1.3, 1.5, 2.0) for different pay rates

RELATIONSHIPS TO IMPLEMENT:
- UserProfile â†’ [ShiftPattern], [Shift], [PayRuleset]
- ShiftPattern â†’ [Shift], [RotationDay], UserProfile
- Shift â†’ ShiftPattern, UserProfile, PayPeriod, CalendarEvent
- PayPeriod â†’ [Shift]
- CalendarEvent â†’ Shift

FILES TO CREATE:
- /ShiftPro/Models/UserProfile.swift
- /ShiftPro/Models/ShiftPattern.swift  
- /ShiftPro/Models/RotationDay.swift
- /ShiftPro/Models/Shift.swift
- /ShiftPro/Models/PayPeriod.swift
- /ShiftPro/Models/PayRuleset.swift
- /ShiftPro/Models/CalendarEvent.swift
- /ShiftPro/Models/Enums.swift (PayPeriodType, ShiftStatus, etc.)
- /ShiftPro/Models/ModelExtensions.swift (computed properties)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- All models compile and build successfully
- Relationships work correctly in SwiftData
- CloudKit sync enabled and tested
- Sample data can be created and persisted
- Model validation prevents invalid states
- Unit tests cover core model functionality

ESTIMATED EFFORT: 8-12 hours
BLOCKERS: None, but depends on project setup

REASONING: Data models are the foundation. Getting these right is critical - changes later require migrations. The minute-based storage and JSON pay rules provide flexibility for different police departments while maintaining type safety.

title: EventKit Calendar Integration
description:
Implement comprehensive two-way calendar synchronization with conflict resolution and stable event management.

INTEGRATION FEATURES:
- Two-way sync between ShiftPro and system calendars
- Dedicated 'Shifts' calendar creation and management
- Conflict detection and resolution strategies
- Background sync with change monitoring
- Support for multiple calendar apps (Apple, Google via CalDAV)

SYNC ARCHITECTURE:
- CalendarIntegrationService as primary coordinator
- Event mapping with stable identifiers
- Change tracking via EKEvent.lastModifiedDate
- Batch operations for performance
- Error recovery and retry logic

CONFLICT RESOLUTION STRATEGY:
- Default mode: Export-only to prevent surprises
- Optional mode: Two-way sync with timestamp comparison
- User override: Manual conflict resolution for ambiguous cases
- Resolution rule: Newest change wins (based on lastModifiedDate)
- Rollback capability: Undo sync if problems detected

EVENT MANAGEMENT:
- Event creation with ShiftPro URL schemes (shiftpro://shift/ID)
- Rich event descriptions with shift details
- Color coding by shift pattern/type
- Alarm configuration for shift reminders
- All-day event support for multi-day shifts

PERMISSION HANDLING:
- EventKit permission requests with clear explanations
- Graceful degradation when calendar access denied
- Re-permission flows for users who change settings
- Permission status monitoring and user feedback

FILES TO CREATE:
- /ShiftPro/Services/CalendarIntegrationService.swift - Main service
- /ShiftPro/Services/EventMapper.swift - Event conversion
- /ShiftPro/Services/ConflictResolver.swift - Conflict handling
- /ShiftPro/Services/CalendarPermissions.swift - Permission management
- /ShiftPro/Models/SyncState.swift - Sync tracking
- /ShiftPro/Views/Settings/CalendarSettingsView.swift - Configuration UI

TECHNICAL CHALLENGES:
- EventKit API limitations and quirks
- Calendar app differences (Apple vs Google vs Outlook)
- Network reliability for CalDAV calendars
- Time zone handling across devices
- Large dataset sync performance

SYNC STATES TO TRACK:
- LocalOnly: Shift exists only in ShiftPro
- Synced: Shift and calendar event in sync
- NeedsUpdate: Shift changed, calendar needs update
- ConflictDetected: Both changed, needs resolution
- Failed: Sync attempt failed, needs retry

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
- Shifts appear correctly in Calendar app
- Changes in Calendar update ShiftPro appropriately
- Conflicts are detected and resolved smoothly
- Background sync works without user intervention
- Performance: <5 seconds for typical sync operations
- No duplicate events or orphaned calendar entries

ESTIMATED EFFORT: 16-20 hours
BLOCKERS: Can start in parallel with pattern engine

REASONING: Calendar integration is a key differentiator. Police officers already use calendars heavily - seamless integration reduces friction and increases adoption. Two-way sync is technically challenging but provides significant user value.
